Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Career Education Corp. agreed to pay $5 million and cancel $493.7 million in student loans to settle multistate litigation alleging that it engaged in unfair and deceptive practices such as failing to disclose information to prospective students on total costs, transferability of credits, program offerings, job placement rates, and other topics.

An Illinois-based operator of several post-secondary schools agreed to pay $30 million to settle Federal Trade Commission charges that it used sales leads from lead generators that falsely told consumers they were affiliated with the U.S. militar, and that used other unlawful tactics to generate leads.
Career Education Corporation agreed to pay $21,200 to resolve a multistate lawsuit concerning student loans.

Career Education Corporation agreed to pay $10.25 million to settle allegations that in disclosures made to students, accreditors, and New York State it significantly inflated its graduates' job placement rates.
